intro: Hibbertia capensis, commonly known as the Cape golden bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and serrated leaves. Hibbertia capensis is adapted to arid conditions, making it drought-resistant and suitable for rock gardens. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
